description: Enterprise techniques used by Rover, ATT&CK software S0090 v1.1
name: Rover (S0090)

techniques.comment: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically collects files from the local system and removable drives based on a predefined list of file extensions on a regular timeframe.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)

[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions and sends them to the command and control server every 60 minutes. [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) also automatically sends keylogger files and screenshots to the C2 server on a regular timeframe.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) persists by creating a Registry entry in HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) searches for files on attached removable drives based on a predefined list of file extensions every five seconds.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) copies files from removable drives to C:\system.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) has keylogging functionality.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) has functionality to remove Registry Run key persistence as a cleanup procedure.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)

[Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) takes screenshots of the compromised system's desktop and saves them to C:\system\screenshot.bmp for exfiltration every 60 minutes.(Citation: Palo Alto Rover)
